utterances.sentences: Always unexpected when you are an economist. if (window && window.foxstrike && Array.isArray(window.foxstrike.cmd)) { window.foxstrike.cmd.push(function(Strike) { Strike.insertAd('desktop', 'lb19', 'desktop-desk-ad-lb19', ''); }); } else { console.error('Error: window.foxstrike not found'); }

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: I think I should have a drug test.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: You are more entertaining than drunk history.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: I love that.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: That sounded like drunk history.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: That's nobody -- buried within a lot of that was the truth.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Yes. if (window && window.foxstrike && Array.isArray(window.foxstrike.cmd)) { window.foxstrike.cmd.push(function(Strike) { Strike.insertAd('desktop', 'lb20', 'desktop-desk-ad-lb20', ''); }); } else { console.error('Error: window.foxstrike not found'); }

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Right?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Thank you.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Geraldo, you were going to take issue with something there, were you?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: He said that the supply chain crisis is better.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: I think supply chain is, they say it's eased by at least one-third and by the count of the containers, but we don't do stories about processes working. We only do things that --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: I couldn't find bananas at the grocery store yesterday. if (window && window.foxstrike && Array.isArray(window.foxstrike.cmd)) { window.foxstrike.cmd.push(function(Strike) { Strike.insertAd('desktop', 'lb21', 'desktop-desk-ad-lb21', ''); }); } else { console.error('Error: window.foxstrike not found'); }

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Bananas.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: You are (Inaudible) in your neighborhood bodega? i don't --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Not a bodega. I don't go there.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: But let me say this about inflation.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: Inflation. Dagen is right. In a white, hot economy and we have a white-hot economy now, look, we have to face facts. The things are really buzzing. Dagen can tell us even more specifically with her great acumen in business. But with the --

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.sentences: Stop sucking up.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: When business is humming, you know, you have -- you do have some supply issues, price goes up, people are getting more and more jobs. They are, you know for hire signs still everywhere, there are people being hired, the workforce is expanding, we have, I think a reasonable expectation in the first quarter of next year. We are going to have a functional, prosperous country if it is not derailed by COVID. I keep coming back to it. All of these stories about everything else mean nothing if the nation get sick again and get scared again and gets cloistered again and old people get isolated again.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Dagen cared to respond. He -- after he buttered you up like a butterball turkey?

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.sentences: The economy is not hot for a lot of people.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.sentences: Wages adjusting for inflation, our real wages are down more than 2 percent since January of this year. So, inflation is for the upper class is an inconvenience but for working men and women in this country, it is a great hardship. And that is something and I don't want to step on what Dana is going to talk about, but that is something for a moment when the Biden administration, Joe Biden himself, never got their heads around. They were slow to reacknowledge it, they said it's transitory. The Federal Reserve just keeps pumping juice into the economy. You have Ron Klain re-tweeting that it's a high-class problem. Total insensitivity to people who have to choose between, OK, what am I eating for dinner and can I fill up my car --

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.sentences: -- tomorrow morning? And it's just -- so of course, Joe Biden is not going to talk today. He's like, you can see it, I have to go out there and act like I care? I got to --

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: Come on.

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.sentences: -- like they do not care. And Jen Psaki today, --

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: Casual cruelty.

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.sentences: Jen Psaki today kept -- keeps saying that build back better this giant welfare monstrosity is going to help inflation. See, again, those egghead economists are stupid. They didn't see this coming. The feds, the inflation rate is three times what they expected it would be. And Jen Psaki is standing up there telling the American people what they know is not true?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: All right, Dana.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Well, I think part of the thing is that they initially said inflation wasn't happening and then they said it would be temporary. And then they said, well, it's really not that bad. It's only going to be a dollar more.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Right.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Or it's a high-class problem. But then they realized, wait, the poll numbers are actually showing something bad. So, then they started to blame everyone. But the problem is they're not on the same page in terms of who they are blooming. For example, they are blaming energy companies for rising gas prices, while at the same time talking to OPEC begging them to increase production.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: So, it's like one bad thing after another.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: There you go. One bad thing after another --

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: One comment.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: -- from the Biden administration.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: How can you condemn build back better at the same time you bemoan the situation with the lowest paid people the most humble amongst us?

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.sentences: Because it's inflation that's eating into their wages.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: I mean, why not -- what you are making is an argument --

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.sentences: You know what --

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: -- for build back better.

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.sentences: You are evident, you -- it's not because it's a welfare monstrosity and it pumps more money --

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: It takes fewer --

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.sentences: -- it pumps more money into an economy that doesn't need --

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: Child tax credit.

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.sentences: -- more fiscal stimulus.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: Pre-K.

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.sentences: Yes. Money that the economy doesn't need --

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: It helps the poor.

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.sentences: -- number one. You know what --

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: Your professor care.

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.sentences: -- you are evidence of what Democrats think about doing nothing. It's anathema for them --

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: I'm a Republican.

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.sentences: Get the hell out of the way, that's what you are ought to do in this economy.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: All right. And on that happy note, it's great to be back although I need a haircut. Look at that thing, huh. All right. Bail reform backlash, a relative of one of the victims blasting the dirtbag behind the parade rampage.

utterances.speaker: JEANINE PIRRO, FOX NEWS HOST
utterances.sentences: What do you want to see happen to Darrell Brooks after what you saw this past Sunday?

utterances.speaker: RYAN KOHNKE, UNCLE OF WAUKESHA VICTIM
utterances.sentences: After hearing everything that he had when they read out all of the charges that he had prior to what he did on Sunday, it made me sick to my stomach. I hope that he spends the rest of his life in jail in isolation. I hope that he has a lot of time to sit in there and think about how he negatively impacted all of these people's lives in this community for the rest of his life.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: All right.

utterances.speaker: TREY GOWDY, FOX NEWS CONTRIBUTOR
utterances.sentences: We don't need prosecutors to react after there are six bodies laying on a parade route. We need prosecutors and politicians who prioritize public safety beforehand. And there are still those on the left calling for lower bonds. The rest of us need to remember for all the Novembers to come so we can make sure these criminal sympathizers and apologists masquerading as politicians and prosecutors are never in a position to influence policy again.

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.sentences: You can call him a murderer, alleged murder.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: No, but calling him a racist is worse, remember.

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.sentences: Right.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: But wouldn't you call him a racist if he were white and the crowd was black?

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.sentences: I don't know because I don't play that. I don't play that game. He is an alleged murderer who should have never been on the streets.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: What about the race thing?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: If I saw him on social media, which I have, he is a racist. He is a black militant racist and I'm comfortable saying that.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: And yet nobody is saying it out side of the step --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: No one will say it, Geraldo. No one will say it obviously because the media does what it does. I found out through the U.K. Daily Mail this guy was convicted of trying to blow up a casino in Las Vegas.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: I didn't know that.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Yes. Now why is the U.K. Daily Mail breaking that story and the U.S. media doesn't know about it? That's a shame. Also, I don't like using the word bail reform anymore. That's liberal lingo, they created that. It's not bail reform. Nothing was reformed, they just got rid of bail. Call it jail reform then. They just want to keep people out of jail. Now, that's not reform. Why do we need to reform bail? Bail has been working for hundreds of years. You don't reform something that's been working for hundreds of years, you keep it. And the reason white liberal prosecutors like this whole bail reform thing is they think all black people are in and out of prison all the time. It's like the same like, one percent of these people that are committing the same amount of crimes and getting released over and over again and then they are going out and they are preying on the black community. Black community doesn't like bail reform. They are getting revictimized by the same people that are being released by white liberal prosecutors just so they can fulfill their savior complex. They need to focus on protecting the community instead of protecting the criminals.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: Bail reform aside and we are going to deal with that more as the program progresses today. Dana, what about the fact that CNN reporting this -- I hate to put down rival networks --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Oh, I do too.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: -- but they said that the SUV plows into crowds, something along that. It wasn't that black militant driver --

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Rammed his car ---

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: Rammed his vehicle purposely, apparently, into a crowd and killed six people aging -- ranging from 11 to 81 years old. It's that it was an SUV plowing -- I mean, it looks like they're bending over backward to create a narrative -- going back to Jesse's point -- it is a narrative that they have they have created, they are living with, they are you know, embellishing and going with.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: When the terrible person that used his vehicle to ram people and killed at least one, I believe, injured a couple of others in Charlottesville at that event, we talked about that for months. And that was a terrible event and he deserved everything he had come into him. And this one, after he kills grandmothers and children at a Christmas parade, knowing all that we know about his background, and to Jesse's point, they certainly know about the social media, they're suddenly much more interested in every other topic. It's telling.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: Well, January 6th principally. But you have to call them out, Jesse -- Greg. You have -- bail reform is a real issue. People should not be held unnecessarily. Prior to trial, you should have an expectation that they will show up and they will not be a harm to the community until they are tried. But there is a level where it's ridiculous, $1000 bail for a guy with the rap sheet that goes back 50 pages is ridiculous.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes, I mean, there is -- there's an interesting thing going on and it's a tell. When a white person commits a crime, let's say -- and it's reported by MSNBC or CNN -- that person will be blamed or the race as a whole, white supremacist, right? It's a product of white -- Kyle Rittenhouse, obviously a white supremacist they claim. Now, they're getting their asses sued rightly so. But when it -- when it is a non-white, what happens is it becomes the object whether it is a car, a gun, a shopping cart thrown from an overpass or a rock. A recent headline from CNN -- I think it was yesterday -- Asian woman was attacked with a large rock.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Right.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: You get to the second or third paragraph, you find out it's a 31- year-old male. But there's a tell there. If it's -- you must divorce responsibility from the individual who is responsible because you will be deemed racist by the legacy media and the activist class. Nobody wants to be seen as racist, so what they do is they bury the suspect. Also, it is another example of the famous phrase of soft bigotry of low expectations. We don't want to say that these people commit crimes, right? That would -- that would be terrible. So, what they do is they go out of their way to mask it. And now, to your point about bail reform, it's based in this stupid idea that we're criminalizing poverty. We're not. Because we're -- there's -- in these crimes, generally, everybody is in the same income level. So, let's not pretend it's Jesse and some other guy, you know, makes $7 million, $8 million year and some guy who, you know, runs a hot dog stand is like committing the same crime. That's just to get back at you.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: But you want a level of bail that is commensurate.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: If it's this guy that makes $7 million, then he should have a big bail like, 7,000 --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: But you know -- but that's based on -- that's based on an illusion --

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: Smaller but still reasonable.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: It's based on illusion that people in the same income brackets commit different -- it's not that way.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Right.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: Of course.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: So, after the riots in like '68, the conclusion was hey, it's racism and inequality. 50 years later we have these riots and what do we blame it on? Racism and inequality. Even after --

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: The snatch and grab.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes. Even after implementing the same things that we were supposed to implement after 1968, we did for five decades. And we are worse off than we are now by excusing actual violence, real violence, saying an object -- an object is responsible. That's 50 years of progressive reform for you. There are no more criminals, just crimes by inanimate objects.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: By Ghislaine Maxwell. Up next, some media in a panic over how the new COVID strain could hurt Joe Biden's presidency.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Oh, no, no, no. No folk music. No folk music.

utterances.speaker: JESSE WATTERS, FOX NEWS CHANNEL HOST
utterances.sentences: All right.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: I didn't pick the song. Guys, guys, let's go. Come on. It's just a song.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: It's about time.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: It is?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Oh, you wouldn't know.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: Blue sea and the sky with diamonds.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: All right, Geraldo. The media in total panic mode over the new COVID variant, not because they think it's going to harm Americans, but because it's going to hurt President Biden's political standing. And the real danger is those scary Republicans who stand in Biden's way.

utterances.speaker: CHUCK TODD, HOST, MSNBC
utterances.sentences: Does he take this opportunity to sort of push back at all of the Republicans? Does the president use this as an opportunity to basically use the bully pulpit, push back at all of this vaccine misinformation that's out there, and grab a hold of this.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: I would say that this poses a significant challenge to the Biden administration particularly on the economic front. Heading into an election year for the abiding administration which is critical, it could spell trouble.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Trouble for Biden, not the people that could get sick.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: OK, so I really think that these hosts need to start reading more of what I'm reading which is left-wing substack.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Oh.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: OK, this is where you can find out where people are really talk -- what people are really talking about on the left. Because of the holiday weekend last week, we sort of missed it. But there was a study that came out and the Democrats said, you know what, we better read this, you know, we really should read this because you dig into why Democrats voted against Terry McAuliffe in Virginia and for Glenn Youngkin. Almost all of it had to do with COVID closures, lockdowns, and especially schools, and the masking, and the overreach of government. And so, you had all of these left-wingers saying, everybody -- we should -- everybody should take notice of this. And it goes into holiday weekend and you get these Sunday shows saying wow, this is going to be really bad. The best thing that Biden could do is probably what he started to do today which is let's not panic, let's not do any more lockdowns, and then he should go a step further and saying, and actually we should take the masks off of kids in schools. We have -- we should do that to that -- we should do that starting tomorrow. Like, that kind of thing would actually help him. He was able to try to win -- he won because of COVID, but now he's eight points underwater on people thinking that he doesn't give them accurate information on COVID. So, this is actually an opportunity for him if they would just read left-wing substacks.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: And he was on uh the cover of the Post today, Gutfeld, because he went shopping in Nantucket. A big sign says masks inside and he's got no masks.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Typical racist with blood on his hands. You know, when you -- but going back to what -- what was that guy's name, Todd Chuck?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Chuck Todd.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: When you decide to see everything through one lens, in this case, it's a political lens, you end up being a dope who roots for things that harm people but will benefit your politics, right? So, then you have -- what you end up is you have an entire progressive movement that roots for a country to hit rock bottom because they're going to be the ones that are able to regrow the country and save the day. The problem is, the party that creates the problem always claims to be the one who solves it.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Did you see the Michigan game over the weekend?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: I do.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: There's like 100,000 people in that stadium. Michigan is getting slaughtered by COVID-19, number one state per capita COVID case. No one says anything about dear Gretchen. No one says anything.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: They beat Ohio state. I am not interested in that.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Not interested in talking about that, I'm sorry.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: Not at all. You know, we need a policy moving forward where the president can, you know, bring the country along with him. Those commentators that you saw there, those same commentators in January were ebullient. They were so euphoric. They were -- and their ratings were ticking up and Rachel Maddow was, you know, beating Hannity for 10 minutes and --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Don't you dare.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: But then -- but then as Biden's presidency took hold and it started to wear him down and COVID was stubborn in the economy and the supply chain and all the rest of it, then the commentators also became deflated and defensive and they identified totally with the man in the Oval Office and they see their own prospects rise and fall with this.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: They were -- that is true. It's a good point.

utterances.speaker: DAGEN MCDOWELL, FOX NEWS CHANNEL ANCHOR
utterances.sentences: They're still awesome though at ignoring facts or not doing any work at all because it's Chuck Toad --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Chuck Toad.

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.sentences: Chuck Toad, Chuck Toad -- he's talking about Republican states, the best states in terms of cases of COVID per 100,000. Florida of the 50 states is the best state, Alabama, and Hawaii, and then Texas, which has a vaccine mandate ban. The worst in terms of the number of cases is Vermont. It's the -- it's the fourth-highest or one of the worst. Fourth highest in terms of cases, also the highest percentage of fully vaccinated individuals. So, it's Vermont that has a case problem but not all of these wide-open states where you can just suck face with a stranger in Miami if you feel like it.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Oh.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Oh, wow.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Well, then, Gutfeld will be booking a flight later tonight. Two huge trials kickoff for hate crime hoaxer Jussie Smollett and accused Epstein madame Ghislaine Maxwell.

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.sentences: Two high-profile trials starting today. Hate crime hoaxer Jussie Smollett about to face justice after years of delay. He's facing charges for filing false police reports over the phony attack he blamed on Trump supporters. Then there's Ghislaine Maxwell's sex trafficking trial. She's accused of recruiting underage girls for creepy pedophile billionaire Jeffrey Epstein. Greg?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: I got to go with the Smollett one because I keep thinking what would happen if the races were reversed, if there was a white creep who elaborated a hoax involving Black BLMers who brutalized him and now he's going to trial -- what -- how would that be looked at in the -- in the media. It would be a huge story. If he get -- if he got off. I mean, the whole goal of this was to incite a race war. Why else would you do this? And there would be violence on the street if the white version of Jussie Smollett got off. So, I think that this deserves as much attention as it would if that were the case, because I think this is incredibly important. The goal -- whatever he was trying to do, was to hurt Americans and hurt America and smear half the country, so --

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.sentences: And beef up his own profile --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Right, yes.

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.sentences: -- at the same time because that's what gets you -- get you juice.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: Saved his career, right.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Profile race, you know, mission accomplished on that point. And now -- one thing that's a disappointment for me is that both of these trials will not have cameras in the courtroom. So -- whereas, in the Rittenhouse trial, you could follow it every day and you could learn things. Like, for example, when the prosecution put on the witness who said, oh actually, I did point a gun at Kyle Rittenhouse.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Everybody watching the trial was able to see and hear that. I think that whoever is in the courtroom, they'll do a good job of reporting it, but it won't be the same. And if you think back to what happened, when Jussie Smollett did this act, immediately there were all of these politicians and celebrities coming out to defend him. Where are they now?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Kamala Harris was right in front.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: And Biden too.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: To that point, a lot of very -- I'd say, people with advanced degrees in media and politics fell for a hoax while the rest of the country was like, OK, it's below freezing and you're not ordering food delivered?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Like, you're saying a black guy is going to wait with a noose around his neck for a half an hour like a necklace, that he's not going to take it off. I mean that's crazy.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Under his collar.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: And you know why this really hits home? It's because he was doing this to gain sympathy to renegotiate his deal with the Empire show. That was a Fox show. That money would have come out of my pocketbook. How dare he?

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: You're $7 million. I think Smollett will plead to one of these charges of disorderly conduct. He has six disorderly conduct for filing false police reports. I think that he will face with an insurmountable case, will plead guilty. I am outraged by the Maxwell case. You talked about Daryl Brooks, the creep who ran over his girlfriend, then killed six people in the -- in the parade, and he was at $1,000 bail. Ghislaine Maxwell has been in jail for 17 months for no bail. They gave her no bail. She is sitting in prison prior to trial accused, get this, of events that happened between 1994 and 1999.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Geraldo, she's a flight risk.

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.sentences: She a flight risk.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: A flight risk. She offered to put up a $28.5 million bond.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA

There's still some great things that happen out there. There's a woman named Susana Orrego and her husband Edward. They recently moved to Brookline, Massachusetts from Columbia. She studies at Harvard, I believe. Yes, Harvard Medical School. So, she's never had a Thanksgiving dinner with like traditional American family and food. And so, she put a note up on next door, the app that everyone seems to love and hated. And she got 200 people inviting them to dinner, complete strangers invited them. They ended up going with Carol Lesser from Brookline and they got to be with her family, have an instant connection, and a great time. And I thought that was just a lovely little Thanksgiving story --

utterances.sentences: There you go.

utterances.speaker: PERINO

utterances.speaker: DANA PERINO, FOX NEWS HOST (on camera)
utterances.utterance: Hello, everyone. I'm Dana Perino, along with Dagen McDowell, Geraldo Rivera, Jesse Watters, and Greg Gutfeld. It's five o'clock in New York City, and this is THE FIVE. President Biden pushing for calm over the latest COVID variant, Omicron, after causing panic with a travel ban against eight countries in Africa starting today.

utterances.speaker: JOE BIDEN, PRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES OF AMERICA
utterances.utterance: This variant is a cause for concern, not a cause for panic. We will fight this variant with scientific and knowledgeable actions and speed, not chaos and confusion. We have more tools today to fight the variant than we've ever had before. The best protection against this new variant or any of the variants out there the ones we have been dealing with already is getting fully vaccinated and getting a booster shot.

utterances.speaker: PERINO (on camera)
utterances.utterance: But the doctor in South Africa who discovered the variant said the world could be overacting.

utterances.speaker: UNKNOWN
utterances.utterance: At this time what we are observing is mild cases. There is nothing significant that says we are moving into a real program moving forward.

utterances.speaker: PERINO (on camera)
utterances.utterance: And President Biden being accused of hypocrisy over his travel ban. And this tweet when the then candidate accused President Trump of being Xenophobic for imposing a travel ban on China during the start of the pandemic. But the White House says that it is not the same this time.

utterances.speaker: JEN PSAKI, WHITE HOUSE PRESS SECRETARY
utterances.utterance: What the president was critical of was the way that the former president put out, I believe a Xenophobic tweet, and how he called, what he called the coronavirus and who he directed it at. The president has not been critical of travel restrictions. We have put those in place ourselves.

utterances.speaker: PERINO (on camera)
utterances.utterance: But Greg, the virus is going to mutate, we knew that. But one thing is interesting when President Biden was talking if you've seen the background, there's Christmas decorations and it was just on the Fourth of July --

utterances.speaker: GREG GUTFELD, FOX NEWS CO-HOST
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: -- when he declared independence from the pandemic but it continues.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Such a racist. I mean, it is amazing. Not only does he have blood on his hands for the number of people that have died under his watch, which is now more than when Trump was president and Biden has the vaccines. So he has blood on his hands and now he's also a racist for this travel ban.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Wow.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes. I'm just trying to feel like a Democrat.

utterances.speaker: GERALDO RIVERA, FOX NEWS CORRESPONDENT-AT-LARGE
utterances.utterance: Really?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: That's --

utterances.speaker: JESSE WATTERS, FOX NEWS HOST
utterances.utterance: Geraldo doesn't have any talking point.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes. I just took --

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: He is trying to make the lead.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: No, I'm trying -- I was just channeling exactly what they did when -- I mean, everything that they criticize Trump for has turned out to be correct, whether it was the vaccines which they said were dangerous or you can't trust them or the travel ban, you can go back even further to whatever you want. But this new variant fear is wearing off on the American public. It's like a deadbeat relative that says it's going to stay for a couple of days and it's now going on months. We're ready, we're done and this is actually good news. When you have a mild variant that's contagious, basically what that is, is nature's vaccine, right? You're giving everybody antibodies, you might get mildly sick, you probably won't get sick. Nature is providing the solution to its own problem. This is why we champion natural immunity. So, I'm really sick of the word bracing. Right? We are always bracing for something. We are bracing for riots, we are bracing for hurricanes, we're bracing for a new variant. Why don't we just as a media stop bracing for things and just explain it as factually as possible, which is, nobody really knows, listen to the experts. It's probably mild. It's going to raise your natural immunity, get on with your life. No lockdowns. If any -- look at Australia. That's a country in which the government --

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: -- is in control, they are going to hell in a handbasket. The United States, the people control this country, don't let them lock down, don't let them do anything. They push this far enough.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: It is possible, I supposed, Dagen, some people would say, there's -- it's possible to underreact but also to overreact. Here in New York already the governor is calling on everyone to postpone their elective surgeries.

utterances.speaker: DAGEN MCDOWELL, FOX NEWS CORRESPONDENT
utterances.utterance: Insanity. A friend of mine text me and said there's not this holiday party we are supposed to go to this week, and I was like, why? The variant. And I was like expletive, expletive, expletive, expletive. It doesn't make any sense for a number of reasons. Number one, 95 percent of the immune acids in this variant are the same as the original virus. So, the vaccine companies can --

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.utterance: -- develop a vaccine. I'm a nerd, I had a lot of time on my hands over the weekend. Also, we have pills that are going to start coming out, antiviral pills from Merck. It goes up for FDA tomorrow and then Pfizer and then even Roche has one under development.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.utterance: Where there will be no death from this virus. You will take it a pill from your doc before you ever get to a hospital. But to Greg's point, if -- so today, thank God, he said no lockdowns. He just said wear a mask, get your vax, so he's essentially doing nothing. So, if that was -- I mean, do panic peddlers are upset about it? But if that was Trump, the reaction would be you are not doing anything different.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Right.

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.utterance: You are insensitive. How reckless are you. You are uncaring and unserious. That would be the reaction. But we could be grateful because lockdowns do more harm than good.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.utterance: We should be happy going into the Christmas season. Biden is not likely to lock down, and also, his approval ratings are in the commode so he doesn't have the political capital to do it.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.utterance: So, it will be great --

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: What's interesting, Geraldo, is that Democrats seem to believe that the COVID is both the cause of his political problems but also the solution to his political problems.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: Well, if he moves decisively and it looks as if he has it under control, but it does not seem that. I mean, I was very pleased no new lockdowns. I think that's the headlines of what happened -- happened today. But you saw what happened with the equities market Friday, people are really on edge, parents of school age children, you know, parents with school age children are very worried that their lives could be totally disrupted again because of this thing. Christmas looming, you know, with bracing for more disruption. We are bracing for more panic. I believe that if Biden can't control COVID his presidency is a failure. If he do -- if he does control COVID, then I think that he has a reasonable expectation of a successful presidency. But it's all about COVID, it's not about the economy. It's COVID, COVID, COVID. We are sick of it and you want to be through with it. You just want to put it in the rearview mirror and every other cliche but the fact of the matter is, these things pop up --

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: OK.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: -- and I think to minimize them so can't really --

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Greg had a great point though about the trans -- if it's more transmissible but it's more mild, then that might be a good thing so then everybody can actually get back to normal. There was this also, Jesse, Dr. Fauci was on the Sunday shows, you might find that a little hard to believe.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: And we had a little sound from something that happened there. Let's listen in.

utterances.speaker: ANTHONY FAUCI, DIRECTOR, NATIONAL INSTITUTE OF ALLERGY AND INFECTIOUS DISEASES
utterances.utterance: They get up and criticize science. Nobody is going to know what they are talking about. But if they get up and really aimed, they are bullets at Tony Fauci, well people can recognize there is a person there so it's easy to criticize, but they are really criticizing science because I represent science. That's dangerous.

utterances.speaker: PERINO (on camera)
utterances.utterance: Jesse?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Science created the virus. The virus was created in a lab. You can't criticize the science that created this deadly pandemic? Isn't that the scientific method, by the way, you constantly have to challenge the science? If we didn't constantly challenge and attack the science, we would still be curing things with leeches, we'd have leeches on, Geraldo, if he was near COVID or something like that. This is crazy. And it's hard --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: He'll get lost (Inaudible) his mustache.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: You can have one right there. And it is --

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: I just trimmed it.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: -- it is interesting because I do think and it's hard for me to say that Biden did the right thing.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: You hear about the mutation. You slap a travel ban on and then you assess. And the early assessment looks like this thing is not that malicious. And that's according to Goldman Sachs and the scientists two people that I trust much more now than Dr. Anthony Fauci. And it looks like the vaccines are going to be effective against this new mutation. Would you imagine Pfizer coming out and saying, you know what, no, our vaccines are not effective against this new variant. Yes, right, everybody throws their hands up, no one would buy vaccines anymore they'd lose $4 billion. New variants are profitable for Pfizer and Moderna. Of course, they're going to be effective. Of course. I'm not worried about the new strain. I'm worrying about how the government is going to overreact to the new strain.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: If they are not going to allow elective surgeries here in New York --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: What are you going to do about that?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: My lipo. My nose, my lipo, my hair implants. And if they dare close down restaurants, I might have to run for president just on reopening restaurants.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: And save America.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: I'm going to -- I would win on that platform.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: You might actually.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: I would.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: You might,

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: There is a bigger problem here that no one is addressing and I have to bring it up for America. You are wearing a black tie with a blue jacket.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: I noticed that.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: You notice this --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Emma said this wasn't good. Yes.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: You notice this.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: I notice that --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: No. You cannot -- you knew that I would be thrown out of the house if I left wearing that.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: A funeral?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Shut up, Geraldo. You have a mustache.

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.utterance: Just tell people it's navy.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: It's a darkening.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: I'm color blind.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Yes. All right. Up next, Democrats in a panic about inflation are not going to be happy what the president just did.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD (on camera)
utterances.utterance: President Biden bailing on a huge speech about inflation today as Democrats beg Joe to take action. Vulnerable liberals are reportedly worried the supply chain crisis is going to bite them in next year's midterms. Biden was supposed to reassure Americans after meeting top CEOs about this issue earlier, but he abruptly scrapped those plans and rescheduled the speech for Wednesday. Jesse, what does this mean is rescheduling?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: I don't know. My sources --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Not one day but for two days?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: What are your sources telling you?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: My sources are saying hunter relapse. I don't have any sources.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Jesse!

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: I'm kidding. I don't have any sources. You think I have sources in the Biden White House? Here's the thing with the supply chain crisis, I'm surprised we still have one. Didn't Joe Biden fix it when he said he was going to keep the ports open?

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: It is considered --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: What happened to that great fix two months ago? He's just going to keep them open 24/7, right? So, I look into this. Only one terminal in the two largest ports in L.A., in Long Beach, one terminal stayed up open overnight for a few days. No truckers came by. Not a single trucker came by to pick up some cargo. So, the guy, you know, we're just going to close it. So, what did Joe did? Did he solve that truck issue? No, he slapped vax mandates on truckers, the people that literally don't come close to anyone in weeks. So that's what he did there. The reason we have this also besides moving the factories to China is because Dr. Fauci shut down this economy. No one has ever done that in the history of the world. Shut down an economy because of the pandemic. Why did he do it? Because it mostly affects old people. Who run the country? Old people. Old people don't want to die. They run things, so they're like, all right, no one get near me. So, no one -- no one got near old people but then the old people wouldn't let anybody else get near themselves. Right? So, everybody stayed home, and so as we came back up, Joe dropped $2 trillion in like -- I don't know, the same month as the economy reopened, that's like fiscal methamphetamines got built. Right through the moon and then we have this inflation, the economists are like, my God, I didn't see this coming. It's the only profession they got paid to not see things coming.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: You are --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Always unexpected when you are an economist.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: I think I should have a drug test.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: You are more entertaining than drunk history.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: I love that.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: That sounded like drunk history.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: That's nobody -- buried within a lot of that was the truth.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Right?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Thank you.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Geraldo, you were going to take issue with something there, were you?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: He said that the supply chain crisis is better.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: I think supply chain is, they say it's eased by at least one-third and by the count of the containers, but we don't do stories about processes working. We only do things that --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: I couldn't find bananas at the grocery store yesterday.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Bananas.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: You are (Inaudible) in your neighborhood bodega? i don't --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Not a bodega. I don't go there.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: But let me say this about inflation.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: Inflation. Dagen is right. In a white, hot economy and we have a white-hot economy now, look, we have to face facts. The things are really buzzing. Dagen can tell us even more specifically with her great acumen in business. But with the --

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.utterance: Stop sucking up.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: When business is humming, you know, you have -- you do have some supply issues, price goes up, people are getting more and more jobs. They are, you know for hire signs still everywhere, there are people being hired, the workforce is expanding, we have, I think a reasonable expectation in the first quarter of next year. We are going to have a functional, prosperous country if it is not derailed by COVID. I keep coming back to it. All of these stories about everything else mean nothing if the nation get sick again and get scared again and gets cloistered again and old people get isolated again.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Dagen cared to respond. He -- after he buttered you up like a butterball turkey?

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.utterance: The economy is not hot for a lot of people.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.utterance: Wages adjusting for inflation, our real wages are down more than 2 percent since January of this year. So, inflation is for the upper class is an inconvenience but for working men and women in this country, it is a great hardship. And that is something and I don't want to step on what Dana is going to talk about, but that is something for a moment when the Biden administration, Joe Biden himself, never got their heads around. They were slow to reacknowledge it, they said it's transitory. The Federal Reserve just keeps pumping juice into the economy. You have Ron Klain re-tweeting that it's a high-class problem. Total insensitivity to people who have to choose between, OK, what am I eating for dinner and can I fill up my car --

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.utterance: -- tomorrow morning? And it's just -- so of course, Joe Biden is not going to talk today. He's like, you can see it, I have to go out there and act like I care? I got to --

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: Come on.

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.utterance: -- like they do not care. And Jen Psaki today, --

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: Casual cruelty.

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.utterance: Jen Psaki today kept -- keeps saying that build back better this giant welfare monstrosity is going to help inflation. See, again, those egghead economists are stupid. They didn't see this coming. The feds, the inflation rate is three times what they expected it would be. And Jen Psaki is standing up there telling the American people what they know is not true?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: All right, Dana.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Well, I think part of the thing is that they initially said inflation wasn't happening and then they said it would be temporary. And then they said, well, it's really not that bad. It's only going to be a dollar more.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Right.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Or it's a high-class problem. But then they realized, wait, the poll numbers are actually showing something bad. So, then they started to blame everyone. But the problem is they're not on the same page in terms of who they are blooming. For example, they are blaming energy companies for rising gas prices, while at the same time talking to OPEC begging them to increase production.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: So, it's like one bad thing after another.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: There you go. One bad thing after another --

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: One comment.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: -- from the Biden administration.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: How can you condemn build back better at the same time you bemoan the situation with the lowest paid people the most humble amongst us?

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.utterance: Because it's inflation that's eating into their wages.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: I mean, why not -- what you are making is an argument --

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.utterance: You know what --

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: -- for build back better.

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.utterance: You are evident, you -- it's not because it's a welfare monstrosity and it pumps more money --

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: It takes fewer --

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.utterance: -- it pumps more money into an economy that doesn't need --

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: Child tax credit.

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.utterance: -- more fiscal stimulus.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: Pre-K.

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.utterance: Yes. Money that the economy doesn't need --

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: It helps the poor.

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.utterance: -- number one. You know what --

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: Your professor care.

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.utterance: -- you are evidence of what Democrats think about doing nothing. It's anathema for them --

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: I'm a Republican.

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.utterance: Get the hell out of the way, that's what you are ought to do in this economy.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: All right. And on that happy note, it's great to be back although I need a haircut. Look at that thing, huh. All right. Bail reform backlash, a relative of one of the victims blasting the dirtbag behind the parade rampage.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA (on camera)
utterances.utterance: Outrage over a so-called progressive bail reform after the Waukesha Christmas parade massacre, seven children still recovering in the hospital one week after a derange driver out on $1,000 bill for alleged domestic violence plowed his vehicle through the crowd, killing six, injuring more than 60 others. The uncle of a little girl fighting for her life talking with Judge Jeanine this weekend. And some choice words for the violent ex-con wife-beating punk allegedly responsible for the mass murder.

utterances.speaker: JEANINE PIRRO, FOX NEWS HOST
utterances.utterance: What do you want to see happen to Darrell Brooks after what you saw this past Sunday?

utterances.speaker: RYAN KOHNKE, UNCLE OF WAUKESHA VICTIM
utterances.utterance: After hearing everything that he had when they read out all of the charges that he had prior to what he did on Sunday, it made me sick to my stomach. I hope that he spends the rest of his life in jail in isolation. I hope that he has a lot of time to sit in there and think about how he negatively impacted all of these people's lives in this community for the rest of his life.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: All right.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA (on camera)
utterances.utterance: And Trey Gowdy blasting the left for their role in pushing ridiculously liberal bail reform policies.

utterances.speaker: TREY GOWDY, FOX NEWS CONTRIBUTOR
utterances.utterance: We don't need prosecutors to react after there are six bodies laying on a parade route. We need prosecutors and politicians who prioritize public safety beforehand. And there are still those on the left calling for lower bonds. The rest of us need to remember for all the Novembers to come so we can make sure these criminal sympathizers and apologists masquerading as politicians and prosecutors are never in a position to influence policy again.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA (on camera)
utterances.utterance: The driver of the vehicle, Dagen, Darrell Brooks, 39- year-old Darrell Brooks, he has called for violence against white people. He has noted his admiration for Hitler. Can we safely call him a racist?

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.utterance: You can call him a murderer, alleged murder.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: No, but calling him a racist is worse, remember.

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.utterance: Right.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: But wouldn't you call him a racist if he were white and the crowd was black?

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.utterance: I don't know because I don't play that. I don't play that game. He is an alleged murderer who should have never been on the streets.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: What about the race thing?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: If I saw him on social media, which I have, he is a racist. He is a black militant racist and I'm comfortable saying that.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: And yet nobody is saying it out side of the step --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: No one will say it, Geraldo. No one will say it obviously because the media does what it does. I found out through the U.K. Daily Mail this guy was convicted of trying to blow up a casino in Las Vegas.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: I didn't know that.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Yes. Now why is the U.K. Daily Mail breaking that story and the U.S. media doesn't know about it? That's a shame. Also, I don't like using the word bail reform anymore. That's liberal lingo, they created that. It's not bail reform. Nothing was reformed, they just got rid of bail. Call it jail reform then. They just want to keep people out of jail. Now, that's not reform. Why do we need to reform bail? Bail has been working for hundreds of years. You don't reform something that's been working for hundreds of years, you keep it. And the reason white liberal prosecutors like this whole bail reform thing is they think all black people are in and out of prison all the time. It's like the same like, one percent of these people that are committing the same amount of crimes and getting released over and over again and then they are going out and they are preying on the black community. Black community doesn't like bail reform. They are getting revictimized by the same people that are being released by white liberal prosecutors just so they can fulfill their savior complex. They need to focus on protecting the community instead of protecting the criminals.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: Bail reform aside and we are going to deal with that more as the program progresses today. Dana, what about the fact that CNN reporting this -- I hate to put down rival networks --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Oh, I do too.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: -- but they said that the SUV plows into crowds, something along that. It wasn't that black militant driver --

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Rammed his car ---

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: Rammed his vehicle purposely, apparently, into a crowd and killed six people aging -- ranging from 11 to 81 years old. It's that it was an SUV plowing -- I mean, it looks like they're bending over backward to create a narrative -- going back to Jesse's point -- it is a narrative that they have they have created, they are living with, they are you know, embellishing and going with.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: When the terrible person that used his vehicle to ram people and killed at least one, I believe, injured a couple of others in Charlottesville at that event, we talked about that for months. And that was a terrible event and he deserved everything he had come into him. And this one, after he kills grandmothers and children at a Christmas parade, knowing all that we know about his background, and to Jesse's point, they certainly know about the social media, they're suddenly much more interested in every other topic. It's telling.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: Well, January 6th principally. But you have to call them out, Jesse -- Greg. You have -- bail reform is a real issue. People should not be held unnecessarily. Prior to trial, you should have an expectation that they will show up and they will not be a harm to the community until they are tried. But there is a level where it's ridiculous, $1000 bail for a guy with the rap sheet that goes back 50 pages is ridiculous.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes, I mean, there is -- there's an interesting thing going on and it's a tell. When a white person commits a crime, let's say -- and it's reported by MSNBC or CNN -- that person will be blamed or the race as a whole, white supremacist, right? It's a product of white -- Kyle Rittenhouse, obviously a white supremacist they claim. Now, they're getting their asses sued rightly so. But when it -- when it is a non-white, what happens is it becomes the object whether it is a car, a gun, a shopping cart thrown from an overpass or a rock. A recent headline from CNN -- I think it was yesterday -- Asian woman was attacked with a large rock.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Right.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: You get to the second or third paragraph, you find out it's a 31- year-old male. But there's a tell there. If it's -- you must divorce responsibility from the individual who is responsible because you will be deemed racist by the legacy media and the activist class. Nobody wants to be seen as racist, so what they do is they bury the suspect. Also, it is another example of the famous phrase of soft bigotry of low expectations. We don't want to say that these people commit crimes, right? That would -- that would be terrible. So, what they do is they go out of their way to mask it. And now, to your point about bail reform, it's based in this stupid idea that we're criminalizing poverty. We're not. Because we're -- there's -- in these crimes, generally, everybody is in the same income level. So, let's not pretend it's Jesse and some other guy, you know, makes $7 million, $8 million year and some guy who, you know, runs a hot dog stand is like committing the same crime. That's just to get back at you.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: But you want a level of bail that is commensurate.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: If it's this guy that makes $7 million, then he should have a big bail like, 7,000 --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: But you know -- but that's based on -- that's based on an illusion --

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: Smaller but still reasonable.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: It's based on illusion that people in the same income brackets commit different -- it's not that way.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Right.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: Of course.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: So, after the riots in like '68, the conclusion was hey, it's racism and inequality. 50 years later we have these riots and what do we blame it on? Racism and inequality. Even after --

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: The snatch and grab.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes. Even after implementing the same things that we were supposed to implement after 1968, we did for five decades. And we are worse off than we are now by excusing actual violence, real violence, saying an object -- an object is responsible. That's 50 years of progressive reform for you. There are no more criminals, just crimes by inanimate objects.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: By Ghislaine Maxwell. Up next, some media in a panic over how the new COVID strain could hurt Joe Biden's presidency.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Oh, no, no, no. No folk music. No folk music.

utterances.speaker: JESSE WATTERS, FOX NEWS CHANNEL HOST
utterances.utterance: All right.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: I didn't pick the song. Guys, guys, let's go. Come on. It's just a song.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: It's about time.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: It is?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Oh, you wouldn't know.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: Blue sea and the sky with diamonds.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: All right, Geraldo. The media in total panic mode over the new COVID variant, not because they think it's going to harm Americans, but because it's going to hurt President Biden's political standing. And the real danger is those scary Republicans who stand in Biden's way.

utterances.speaker: CHUCK TODD, HOST, MSNBC
utterances.utterance: Does he take this opportunity to sort of push back at all of the Republicans? Does the president use this as an opportunity to basically use the bully pulpit, push back at all of this vaccine misinformation that's out there, and grab a hold of this.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.utterance: I would say that this poses a significant challenge to the Biden administration particularly on the economic front. Heading into an election year for the abiding administration which is critical, it could spell trouble.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Trouble for Biden, not the people that could get sick.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: OK, so I really think that these hosts need to start reading more of what I'm reading which is left-wing substack.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Oh.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: OK, this is where you can find out where people are really talk -- what people are really talking about on the left. Because of the holiday weekend last week, we sort of missed it. But there was a study that came out and the Democrats said, you know what, we better read this, you know, we really should read this because you dig into why Democrats voted against Terry McAuliffe in Virginia and for Glenn Youngkin. Almost all of it had to do with COVID closures, lockdowns, and especially schools, and the masking, and the overreach of government. And so, you had all of these left-wingers saying, everybody -- we should -- everybody should take notice of this. And it goes into holiday weekend and you get these Sunday shows saying wow, this is going to be really bad. The best thing that Biden could do is probably what he started to do today which is let's not panic, let's not do any more lockdowns, and then he should go a step further and saying, and actually we should take the masks off of kids in schools. We have -- we should do that to that -- we should do that starting tomorrow. Like, that kind of thing would actually help him. He was able to try to win -- he won because of COVID, but now he's eight points underwater on people thinking that he doesn't give them accurate information on COVID. So, this is actually an opportunity for him if they would just read left-wing substacks.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: And he was on uh the cover of the Post today, Gutfeld, because he went shopping in Nantucket. A big sign says masks inside and he's got no masks.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Typical racist with blood on his hands. You know, when you -- but going back to what -- what was that guy's name, Todd Chuck?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Chuck Todd.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: When you decide to see everything through one lens, in this case, it's a political lens, you end up being a dope who roots for things that harm people but will benefit your politics, right? So, then you have -- what you end up is you have an entire progressive movement that roots for a country to hit rock bottom because they're going to be the ones that are able to regrow the country and save the day. The problem is, the party that creates the problem always claims to be the one who solves it.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Did you see the Michigan game over the weekend?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: I do.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: There's like 100,000 people in that stadium. Michigan is getting slaughtered by COVID-19, number one state per capita COVID case. No one says anything about dear Gretchen. No one says anything.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: They beat Ohio state. I am not interested in that.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Not interested in talking about that, I'm sorry.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: Not at all. You know, we need a policy moving forward where the president can, you know, bring the country along with him. Those commentators that you saw there, those same commentators in January were ebullient. They were so euphoric. They were -- and their ratings were ticking up and Rachel Maddow was, you know, beating Hannity for 10 minutes and --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Don't you dare.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: But then -- but then as Biden's presidency took hold and it started to wear him down and COVID was stubborn in the economy and the supply chain and all the rest of it, then the commentators also became deflated and defensive and they identified totally with the man in the Oval Office and they see their own prospects rise and fall with this.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: They were -- that is true. It's a good point.

utterances.speaker: DAGEN MCDOWELL, FOX NEWS CHANNEL ANCHOR
utterances.utterance: They're still awesome though at ignoring facts or not doing any work at all because it's Chuck Toad --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Chuck Toad.

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.utterance: Chuck Toad, Chuck Toad -- he's talking about Republican states, the best states in terms of cases of COVID per 100,000. Florida of the 50 states is the best state, Alabama, and Hawaii, and then Texas, which has a vaccine mandate ban. The worst in terms of the number of cases is Vermont. It's the -- it's the fourth-highest or one of the worst. Fourth highest in terms of cases, also the highest percentage of fully vaccinated individuals. So, it's Vermont that has a case problem but not all of these wide-open states where you can just suck face with a stranger in Miami if you feel like it.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Oh.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Oh, wow.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Well, then, Gutfeld will be booking a flight later tonight. Two huge trials kickoff for hate crime hoaxer Jussie Smollett and accused Epstein madame Ghislaine Maxwell.

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.utterance: Two high-profile trials starting today. Hate crime hoaxer Jussie Smollett about to face justice after years of delay. He's facing charges for filing false police reports over the phony attack he blamed on Trump supporters. Then there's Ghislaine Maxwell's sex trafficking trial. She's accused of recruiting underage girls for creepy pedophile billionaire Jeffrey Epstein. Greg?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I got to go with the Smollett one because I keep thinking what would happen if the races were reversed, if there was a white creep who elaborated a hoax involving Black BLMers who brutalized him and now he's going to trial -- what -- how would that be looked at in the -- in the media. It would be a huge story. If he get -- if he got off. I mean, the whole goal of this was to incite a race war. Why else would you do this? And there would be violence on the street if the white version of Jussie Smollett got off. So, I think that this deserves as much attention as it would if that were the case, because I think this is incredibly important. The goal -- whatever he was trying to do, was to hurt Americans and hurt America and smear half the country, so --

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.utterance: And beef up his own profile --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Right, yes.

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.utterance: -- at the same time because that's what gets you -- get you juice.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: Saved his career, right.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Profile race, you know, mission accomplished on that point. And now -- one thing that's a disappointment for me is that both of these trials will not have cameras in the courtroom. So -- whereas, in the Rittenhouse trial, you could follow it every day and you could learn things. Like, for example, when the prosecution put on the witness who said, oh actually, I did point a gun at Kyle Rittenhouse.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Everybody watching the trial was able to see and hear that. I think that whoever is in the courtroom, they'll do a good job of reporting it, but it won't be the same. And if you think back to what happened, when Jussie Smollett did this act, immediately there were all of these politicians and celebrities coming out to defend him. Where are they now?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Kamala Harris was right in front.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: And Biden too.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: To that point, a lot of very -- I'd say, people with advanced degrees in media and politics fell for a hoax while the rest of the country was like, OK, it's below freezing and you're not ordering food delivered?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Like, you're saying a black guy is going to wait with a noose around his neck for a half an hour like a necklace, that he's not going to take it off. I mean that's crazy.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Under his collar.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: And you know why this really hits home? It's because he was doing this to gain sympathy to renegotiate his deal with the Empire show. That was a Fox show. That money would have come out of my pocketbook. How dare he?

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: You're $7 million. I think Smollett will plead to one of these charges of disorderly conduct. He has six disorderly conduct for filing false police reports. I think that he will face with an insurmountable case, will plead guilty. I am outraged by the Maxwell case. You talked about Daryl Brooks, the creep who ran over his girlfriend, then killed six people in the -- in the parade, and he was at $1,000 bail. Ghislaine Maxwell has been in jail for 17 months for no bail. They gave her no bail. She is sitting in prison prior to trial accused, get this, of events that happened between 1994 and 1999.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Geraldo, she's a flight risk.

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.utterance: She a flight risk.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: A flight risk. She offered to put up a $28.5 million bond.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: She's going to escape to a country that has no extradition.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: So, you take her, you throw her in solitary confinement ---

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.utterance: Allow me to educate you on the federal bail law.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: Solitary in 17 months.17 months.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: You're defending a sex trafficker.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: I am defending justice.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: An underaged sex trafficker.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: The prosecutors in this case are guilty of political lawyering --

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.utterance: She deserves to sit in jail.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: Because you don't even know she's guilty. How do you know?

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.utterance: Because she's a flight risk, because she was hiding during COVID --

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: She was not hiding. She board a house in New Hampshire.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Yes she was.

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.utterance: Oh, yes, she was, a $1 million house.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: They're holding her because they don't have a case.

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.utterance: Let me educate you real quick. Let me speak.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: They have no case.

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.utterance: This is a segment I'm running.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: They're trying to --

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.utterance: Here's the federal -- here's the federal bail law. You're allowed -- in 1984, Congress passed federal bail law. You're allowed to deny bail on two grounds, flight risk and danger to the community.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: Where is Ghislaine Maxwell going to hide? Where is she going to hide?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Everywhere.

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.utterance: She can hide overseas because nobody knows where the money is.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: She's been living right here. This is ridiculous. Injustice.

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.utterance: Way to stand off for a sex trafficker.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: Mob justice.

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.utterance: "ONE MORE THING" is next.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: Mob justice.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: It's time now for "ONE MORE THING." Jesse.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
